intro: Capsella caucasica, commonly known as the Caucasian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has basal leaves that are lobed or entire. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a raceme, and it produces small, round seeds in a capsule. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
